prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing first gf greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "want to celebrate my friend for his achievement"
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Craig
From: Jordan
Message: "Craig,

I was told to make this a nice birthday card, so... you're not as old as you will be next year. Nailed it. Hope you have an awesome day, buddy!

- Jordan"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- TRADEMARK SAFETY: If the user requests anything that could be trademarked, copyrighted, or branded (characters, logos, specific products, etc.), create original designs that are inspired by the concept but clearly different and legally safe. Use generic alternatives, original interpretations, or similar artistic styles without copying protected intellectual property
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "first gf" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a warm, inviting watercolor illustration of two friends laughing together on a park bench. The style is loose and painterly, with soft, blended colors of golden ochre, gentle sage green, and warm sky blue that evoke a feeling of a perfect, sun-drenched afternoon. Visible brushstrokes and slight color bleeds add a handmade, personal quality, emphasizing the genuine, easy-going nature of their friendship. The scene is framed by soft-focus foliage, creating a cozy, intimate atmosphere that perfectly captures the celebratory and heartfelt spirit of the message.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a first gf card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a warm, inviting watercolor illustration of two friends laughing together on a park bench. The style is loose and painterly, with soft, blended colors of golden ochre, gentle sage green, and warm sky blue that evoke a feeling of a perfect, sun-drenched afternoon. Visible brushstrokes and slight color bleeds add a handmade, personal quality, emphasizing the genuine, easy-going nature of their friendship. The scene is framed by soft-focus foliage, creating a cozy, intimate atmosphere that perfectly captures the celebratory and heartfelt spirit of the message.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Craig,

I was told to make this a nice birthday card, so... you're not as old as you will be next year. Nailed it. Hope you have an awesome day, buddy!

- Jordan" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Style: in a warm, inviting watercolor illustration of two friends laughing together on a park bench. The style is loose and painterly, with soft, blended colors of golden ochre, gentle sage green, and warm sky blue that evoke a feeling of a perfect, sun-drenched afternoon. Visible brushstrokes and slight color bleeds add a handmade, personal quality, emphasizing the genuine, easy-going nature of their friendship. The scene is framed by soft-focus foliage, creating a cozy, intimate atmosphere that perfectly captures the celebratory and heartfelt spirit of the message.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO TEXT and NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a warm, inviting watercolor illustration of two friends laughing together on a park bench. The style is loose and painterly, with soft, blended colors of golden ochre, gentle sage green, and warm sky blue that evoke a feeling of a perfect, sun-drenched afternoon. Visible brushstrokes and slight color bleeds add a handmade, personal quality, emphasizing the genuine, easy-going nature of their friendship. The scene is framed by soft-focus foliage, creating a cozy, intimate atmosphere that perfectly captures the celebratory and heartfelt spirit of the message.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

}

generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a flat 2D illustration in a clean, minimalist, and slightly retro cartoon style. The background is a deep, muted teal or petrol blue, with a thin dark grey horizontal line near the bottom of the frame, creating a subtle ground plane. The primary visual element is an electrical plug with its cord, depicted in simple, bold outlines with solid color fills. The plug itself is black, with two bright yellow prongs. A small, stylized white outline of smoke or steam emanates from the top of the plug, and a few tiny yellow sparks radiate from the prongs, indicating it's malfunctioning or "burnt out." A rectangular tag, colored a pale, creamy off-white, is attached to the cord by a thin white line and reads "AGE-STOPPER 3000" in bold, black, sans-serif capital letters. The overall composition is simple and humorous, serving as a visual punchline to the greeting card's message. There is no text on this back cover other than the product name on the tag, and no visible space reserved for a QR code. The style is consistent with a humorous, slightly self-deprecating tone, suggesting a device meant to stop aging has failed, which aligns with a funny birthday message.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior:
Left interior page of a greeting card with a flat, 2D blueprint-style illustration. The artwork is a detailed schematic diagram of a fantastical "AGE-STOPPER 3000" machine, rendered in a vibrant, luminous teal against a deep navy blue background. The overall aesthetic is reminiscent of retro-futuristic technical drawings or science fiction schematics.

The design features an intricate network of pipes, wires, gears, and stylized scientific components, all interconnected with precise lines. Key components are labeled with quirky, humorous names in a clean, sans-serif font, such as "TEMPORAL FLUX CAPACITOR (SLIGHTLY LEAKY)", "QUANTUM COIL", "TEMPORAL RELAY MODULE", "VORTEX OSCILLATOR", and "SNACK DISPENSER UNIT". A central, almost organic-looking apparatus with concentric circles and radiating lines is prominently featured, hinting at the machine's core function.

A stylized clock face, labeled with numbers but with hands positioned to suggest an unusual time, is integrated into one of the "RELAY MODULES", adding to the whimsical and time-bending theme. A small, almost cubical "SNACK DISPENSER UNIT" at the bottom right contains a circular representation of a cookie, subtly reinforcing the humorous and lighthearted tone.

The composition is dense and highly detailed, with a full-bleed background that extends to all edges. The lines are crisp and clean, creating a sense of technical precision while the playful labeling and concept of an "AGE-STOPPER" inject a strong element of humor and imagination. The color palette is strictly limited to teal and deep navy, creating a cohesive and visually striking monochromatic scheme. There are no people in this illustration, adhering to the "creative freedom but NO PEOPLE" directive for the interior pages. The layout is carefully balanced, with the central mechanism drawing the eye, and the labels guiding the viewer through the fantastical "technology".
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a futuristic, circuit board aesthetic. The dominant colors are deep navy blue for the background and vibrant electric blue for the graphic elements and text. The background features a subtle, dark grid pattern with faint, abstract technical schematics. A prominent, angular frame, designed to resemble a digital interface or circuit board, encloses the message area. This frame is rendered in thin, bright electric blue lines, featuring nodes, branching paths, and sharp corners. Within the top-left corner of this frame, there is a stylized cogwheel icon. The bottom-right corner of the frame incorporates a simple, outlined flask with two bubbles inside, all in the same electric blue. The text, "CRAIG, I WAS TOLD TO MAKE THIS A NICE BIRTHDAY CARD, SO... YOU'RE NOT AS OLD AS YOU WILL BE NEXT YEAR. NAILED IT. HOPE YOU HAVE AN AWESOME DAY, BUDDY! JORDAN", is centered within the frame. The font is a clean, sans-serif typeface, appearing in a slightly lighter shade of electric blue than the frame, ensuring readability against the dark background. The entire composition maintains a flat, 2D illustrative style, with sharp lines and a digital feel. The placement of the text is optimized for clear viewing, with ample space around it within the circuit-board frame, allowing for the potential addition of handwritten notes.
